Name: Additional Reactivity
Author: juliabel
About: Additional reactivity for character backgrounds. English and russian languages.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial release

Description:
This is my first (and not the last I hope) attempt to add some more reactivity for backgrounds, part one is for Prologue. Great thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/users/867208]RomeoReject[/url], who translated mod to english, so now all english-speaking people can try it too. If you see errors in text, feel free to tell me about it, i'll fix it. If you wanna translate it to some other languages, you're welcome.


Mostly its "I know this already" stuff, like Navi Officer knows about Navigators or Psyker knows about danger of the warp. Psykers got some discipline-related reactivity, at least 1 for all disciple. "Choosing Conviction" scene got some changes (texts only, sorry again, animations are too complex for me). And 2 more points where you can get new epilogue bookpage. :)

Попытка добавить чуток реактивности для предысторий, часть первая - Пролог. В основном, хоть какой-то способ убрать тупые вопросы типа "Что такое Навигатор?" для нависов, немножко "типичных" реакций, чуть-чуть мест, где у псайкеров работает дисциплина, теперь все дисциплины имеют минимум по одной точке. Несколько переписала сцену с выбором конвикшена (катсцену не трогала, это для меня слишком сложно). Ну и добавила парочку мест с досрочным получением эпилога. :)

Installation guide:
1. [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases/tag/v1.14]MicroPatches mod[/url] - required. Create a directory MicroPatches in UnityModManager directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader), and unpack archive with latest release there.
2. Unpack archive with my mod into Modifications directory (<Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 4000 Rogue Trader).

3. Create "OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json" file in the <Users>\<username>\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader
4. Open it with notepad and paste { "EnabledModifications": ["AddReactivityProlog"] } 
OR
3. [url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases/]Modfinder[/url] - get latest release, unpack it somewhere in your computer, run and manage your RT mods.

Updating guide:
Delete mod directory with previous version before installing new one, because I renamed almost all files (for more compatibility with next official updates).

Name: Adepta Sororitas Sabbat-Pattern Helmets
Author: DarthParametric
About: Adds several Sabbat-pattern helmets for Argenta (or mod-added Sororitas background RTs) throughout the game.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
For Rogue Trader v1.2.1.26.

- Corrected manifest version to sync with Github tag

For Rogue Trader v1.2.1.26.

- Revised helmet textures to better match the vanilla armour textures
- Added MicroPatches as a dependency to the mod manifest

Initial release for Rogue Trader v1.2.1.26.

- Adds several helmets for everyone's favourite Sister of Battle (or mod-added Sororitas RT)
- Two are available via the Drusian vendor in chapters 2 and 4
- Two are mutually exclusive and come alongside her unique armour at the end of her personal quest in chapter 4

Description:
#  Adepta Sororitas Sabbat-Pattern Helmets
A mod for Owlcat's Rogue Trader cRPG. Adds several Sabbat-pattern helmets for Argenta (or mod-added Sororitas background RTs) throughout the game.

## Overview
This mod adds the familiar Sabbat-pattern helmet employed by the Adepta Sororitas. Owlcat did initially showcase Argenta wearing one in the pre-release trailers, but for whatever reason this was removed and no longer exists in the game files. This is a new model made by me (although a hooded version uses one of Owlcat's hood models).

The mod contains four helmets. The first two - the standard base version and a hooded Celestian version - are available in chapters 2 and 4, respectively, via the Drusian vendor. The remaining two are paired with Argenta's mutually exclusive quest armours, available at the end of chapter 4. Additionally, this mod makes a minor tweak to the final cutscene/conversation of this quest to ensure that Argenta actually equips the armour she gains.

## Installation
This is an Owlmod, made using the Unity template supplied by Owlcat. Currently the game has a bug that prevents Owlmods from working. To fix this, you ***must*** install the Unity Mod Manager-based mod [MicroPatches](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches/releases) by microsoftenator2022. You can install it manually or via [ModFinder](https://github.com/CasDragon/ModFinder/releases/latest).

To install this mod, first make sure you have run the game at least once. Download the archive and extract it into:

%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
Each Owlmod needs to be in its own sub-folder in the Modifications folder.

Afterwards, you need to edit OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json in the base Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader folder in a text editor (Notepad++ recommended). It should look something like this:

```
{
"$id": "1",
"SourceDirectories": [],
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet"],
"DisabledModifications": []
}
```

If you have other mods, list them in quotes separated by commas. For example:

```
"EnabledModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
"ActiveModifications": ["DPAdeptaSororitasSabbatHelmet", "ModName2", "ModName3"],
```

You can move individual mods from the ActiveModifications section to the DisabledModifications section if you want to disable them without physically removing them.

Alternatively, use [ModFinder](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146) to install the mod.

It should be fine to install the mod in an existing game at any point right up to completing Argenta's quest in chapter 4 (or after if you're willing to use Toybox to manually spawn the helmets).

## Known Issues
There will be some log spam after the final cutscene of Argenta's personal quest (although the vanilla version also has a bunch of error logs) seemingly due to the game trying to equip Argenta before she has rejoined the party. I did try tweaking the scene to prevent this but to no avail. Despite the error logs, everything seems to work fine. She will be wearing the armour and associated helmet for the path she's on when she returns to you (check the images tab for a screenshot).

The mod will be incompatible with any other mod that edits the CommandAction9 and CommandAction10 blueprints for the Argenta_Q2_ArgentaReturn_KTC cutscene. It's an unfortunate limitation of the way Owlmod blueprint patches work. It will probably also break (at least until I update it) if Owlcat patch those blueprints or otherwise alter the scene at some point to fix the vanilla bug.

This mod creates a save dependency! You won't be able to load a save that used it if you later uninstall the mod.

## Acknowledgements
Many thanks to the modders on the Owlcat Dicord, but particularly microsoftenator2022 and Kurufinve, for helping to coach me through my ineptitude in order to get the mod working.

Name: Allow Modded Achievements
Author: AlterAsc
About: Separate mod to allow achievements while modded.

VersionHistory.Changelog: updated for game version 1.0.97
Initial release

Description:
# Allow Modded Achievements mod for Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader

Separate mod to allow achievements while modded.

If you use Toy Box checkbox you don't need it.    

If you install both this and Toy Box, this mod applies regardless of Toy Box checkbox state.

## Installation
1. Unpack archive directly into `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\` WITHOUT creating additional archive named folder.
2. After running the game, navigate to UMM mod settings (press Ctrl-F10) and set settings as you need.

Resulting structure of already existing UnityModManager folder should be as follows
- `AllowModdedAchievements` (folder)
	- `AllowModdedAchievements.dll`
	- `Info.info`
	- `OwlcatModificationManifest.json`

## How to build (for developers only)
1. Set up RoguePath environment variable to point to game folder
2. Restore nuget packages
3. Clean Solution.
4. Build (note that on build output is automatically copied to installation path).


## Credits
To Xenofell for making "Allow Modded Achievements" for Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous
To Petirep for creating image meme used for thumbnail

Name: Better Jae Talents
Author: Mawootad
About: Makes Jae's officer talents not a complete garbage fire
Description:
Updates Jae's base officer talents to make her much better at shooting things and make her heroic action not feel wasted compared to what
Cassia or a merc offers. Her new talents are as follows:

Abilities:
[list]
[*]Air of Authority
[*]Get Back in the Fight!
[/list]
Level Ups:[list]
[*]Ballistic Skill x2
[*]Fellowship x2
[*]Perception
[/list]
Skills:
[list]
[*]Lore Imperium
[*]Commerce
[*]Lore Xenos x2
[/list]
Class Talents:
[list]
[*]Leader's Assault
[*]Decisive Response
[*]Lead by Example
[*]Lasting Impression
[*]Wounds Are No Excuse!
[/list]
Common Talents:
[list]
[*]Ready to Serve
[*]Swift Movements
[*]Perception Training
[*]It Will Not Die
[/list]
Heroic Action:
[list]
[*]-1 AP Cost for non-attacks
[*]Increased damage and permanent Voice of Command
[/list]
The intended usage of this is to use Air of Authority + Get Back In The Fight! in order to set up Lead By Example and then Voice of Command to self-buff Jae's BS and Perception enough to reliably hit things without needing a second officer to buff her.

Note that this does not apply retroactively, you'll need to have this active when you recruit Jae for the first time in order for it to work.

Name: Better Type Sorting
Author: Arkive
About: This UMM mod patches inventory type sorting, so it sorts by subtypes, families, catgories, handedness, etc within weapons and armor categories

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added sorting to the ALL tab. Updated to work with Rogue Trader V1.2

Description:
This UMM mod patches inventory type sorting, so there's more detail to weapon and armor sorting than just alphabetical by display name.

[b]New sorting steps:[/b]
Armor sorting
[list=1]
[*]Racial Restriction
[*]Category (Light, Medium, Heavy)

[*]Armor Value
[*]Deflection
[*]Name
[/list]Weapon sorting
[list=1]
[*]Melee / Ranged
[*]Family (Damage type. e.g. Las,bolt)
[*]Category (e.g. Basic, Pistol)
[*]1 handed / 2 handed
[*]Heavy
[*]Name
[/list]Consumables
[list=1]
[*]Blueprint Name (I didn't find a usable (sub)type field, but most consumables are
prefixed with a subcategory. So most consumables are with their own
type, but not all.)
[/list]
[b]Installation:
[/b][list=1]
[*]        Download the mod file and unzip
[*]        If the folder is not already named BetterTypeSorting please rename it to that
[*]        Launch the game at least once.
[*]        Please note that the game comes with its own built in Unity Mod Manager so you do not need to install another one
[*]        Navigate to [i]%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games[/i]\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
[*]        An example path is C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
[*]        Copy BetterTypeSorting into the UnityModManagerFolder
[*]        Launch Rogue Trader and you may need to hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window
[*]        Load a save or start a new game
[*] ﻿Open your inventory, navigate to the weapons or armor tab, select one of the 'type' sorting options

[/list]
[b]Questions:[/b]
[list]
[*]Can I add/remove this mod to a saved game?
[list]
[*]Yes
[/list][*]Is this mod compatible with X mod?
[list]
[*]It may conflict with other mods if they change how the inventory is sorted.
[/list][*]Doesn't the base game already sort by type and categories?
[list]
[*]Version 1.2 added a lot more sorting criteria, but this mod still has more sorting criteria for armor.
[/list][/list]

Name: Bigger Flagship
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Increases the visual size of your flagship to make it more impressive.
Description:
Would a venerable dynasty like Von Velancius really rule from a mere frigate? I say no. This mod increases the visual model of your flagship, putting it closer to the size of a cruiser in-game.

Your ship still has its original footprint on the game map and no functionality is changed. I tried making it an actual cruiser, but things got real weird. As it is, diagonal alignments look a bit off.

In order for the change to take effect, you'll need to load into the game with the mod installed and then save the game from a star system map or a space battle then reload that save.

To install, extract the folder from the .zip file and place it in C:\Users\[you]\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager

Name: Cold Trader Origin
Author: jonHinkerton
About: APlay your Rogue Trader or custom companions as the Cold Trader origin exclusive to Jae.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Full rework into an origin following the style of other choices with new talents.

Added two-weapon fighting so gunsliger will work like Jae from the start.
Added dual-weapon fighting due to confusion with gunslinger
Initial Release

Description:
This mod expands upon Jae's Cold Trader origin, making it a fully fleshed-out origin suitable for PC use with a class ability, 5 talents, and associated stat and skill modifiers.

The class ability is Cold Trader's Acumen - grants a number of buffs based on your reputation with the trade factions.

The Talents include the remainder of the original talents plus three new ones that emphasize their focus on Skills, Fellowship, and Perception:

[list]
[*]Gunslinger reduces the cost of second weapon attacks while dual wielding.
[*]Never Play Fair allows you to use Fellowship for Int-based skills
[*]Cold Confidence lets the trader use Fellowship in place of Willpower
[*]Closer improves armor penetration on weakened opponents
[*]Watch Your Back uses Perception in place of Agility for dodge.

[/list]
Their triumphs and darkest hours have original text rather than copying the crime lord.
This mod also fixes the bug where Cold Trader's Acumen does not add the mentioned Coercion buff.

Note: This mod does not change Jae's abilities or options, only those of a Rogue Trader or mercenary companion.

Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for ColdTraderOccupation following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Disable Cutscene Overlay
Author: Hambeard
About: This mod will disable the annoying (IMO) camera overlay leaving you with a cleaner view.  I still like the letterbox effect but there is an option in UMM Menu (ctrl+f10) to disable letterboxing as well.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed: Save settings throwing an exception.
Recompile for 1.2.1.26
Initial Release.

Description:
# RTDisableCutsceneOverlay
 Disables Cutscene Overlay in Rogue Trader

Name: Enable All Archetypes
Author: Ode
About: Enable all classes for all archetypes

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added blade dancer & executioner combos for the new DLC.
Enables you to choose any archetype with any class. UMM mod so copy to users/[username]/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader/UnityModManager/
Fix for missing soldier to executioner

Description:
# SnarkAllClasses (Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader)

Enable all classes for all archetypes

Name: Enhanced Controls
Author: AlterAsc
About: Adds couple of new keybindings

VersionHistory.Changelog: added walk toggle and force walk when shift is pressed
removed all the options that were added in base game in 1.2.0
add 'Place taken talents last' setting

add Previous Menu Tab hotkey
fix collect all sometimes not working

Added Prev Character button

Fixed bugs:
- highlight not turning off at the start of space combat
- separate end turn button not working in space combat
1.0.0 release

Description:
# EnhancedControls - mod for Warhammer 40000: Rogue Trader

Adds UX related stuff. 

If you're a user, downloads are on the right. See **Releases** link.
You can see detailed mod description on [Nexus page](https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/14) or [Steam workshop page](https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3114200965) (or in Workshop-description.txt file).


## How to build

1. Get the usual tools (Visual Studio and .NET development stuff)
2. Clone the repo
3. Build. And then Build again. Project looks up your RT installation dir from your game logs (so you need to run the game at least once).

That's it. On Build output is copied into UMM folder in appdata.


## How to contribute localization

After installing the mod localization files are in `Localization` folder.   
If you named mod install folder `EnhancedControls` then full path to them would be `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\EnhancedControls\Localization`

English localization is in `enGB.json`

Copy this file and rename new file according to the language you're translating into.
Russian  - `ruRU.json`    
German   - `deDE.json`   
French   - `frFR.json`   
Chinese  - `zhCN.json`    
Spanish  - `esES.json`   
Japanese - `jaJP.json`   

(If your system is set to hide file extensions and you don't see `.json`, then ignore that part)

Open your new localization file with any text editor - but for best results use something with syntax highlight - Notepad++, Visual Studio Code, or something else.   
Change **Text** properties to translate things.  
Start the game in chosen language to see the effect. Or switch the language in settings, the mod will reload your changes.

Send me translation file if you want me to include your translation with the mod.

Name: Equipment Transmog
Author: ADDB
About: Allows picking the visual equipment for a slot separately from actual equipment.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed issue where opening Weapon Browser or switching Characters would crash the mod.
Add red label to items with no EquipmentEntities to make them more recognizeable.
Thanks to BarleyFlour: Add transmog for same weapon type (FXs unaffected)
Initial Release

Description:
[b]Installation[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod archive.
[*]If not done yet, launch the game at least once.
[*]Navigate to [code]%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/code]
For example, the path might look like this: [i]C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/i]

[*]Create a new folder in the UnityModManager directory and unarchive the mod archive there.
[*]Launch Rogue Trader and after reaching the Main Menu you can hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window.
[/list]

[b]Usage[/b]
To use:
[list=1]
[*]Click the button in RTTransmog mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened by pressing CTRL + F10)
[*]Open the Browser for the respective Slot you want to override (this UI should be familiar to ToyBox users).
[*]The mod will automatically keep track of every item in your inventory when first opening the mod in a save, and of each item that is added to your inventory after installation. By default, it will only show items you have encountered before. Optionally, you can use the "Show All" disclosure toggle to view every possible item.
[/list]

Since using Mods normally disables Achievements, I suggest also using the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/4]Allow Modded Achievements[/url] mod or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] to re-enable them.

Name: Expanded Archetypes
Author: jonHinkerton
About: Expanded Archetypes is a project to add new abilities and talents to the existing character class archetypes in Rogue Trader. The goal is to provide novelty, added variety, and more interesting build decisions.

VersionHistory.Changelog: First release version. Soldier added. Shotgun tree moved to soldier and flame tree added for warrior.
Officer added
Initial release

Description:
Expanded Archetypes is a project to add new abilities and talents to the existing character class archetypes in Rogue Trader. The goal is to provide novelty, added variety, and more interesting build decisions.

The version 1.0 goal was to add one ability and three talents to each of the original four tier 1 archetypes. I am trying to loosely theme these around the idea of trees, related features that build out a clear but missing niche for those paths. I would then like to move on to either doubling those additions or moving on to tier 2 in the next release. I am more focused on tier 1 though as I feel that is where broader choices belong while tier 2 is intended for specialization.

The Soldier gets a shotgun tree.
[list]
[*]The Pistol Whip ability lets a ranged weapon-equipped soldier mix in some melee up close.
[*]The Butt Strike talent gives additional damage to Pistol Whip when using a two-handed ranged weapon.
[*]The Street Sweeper talent makes pushbacks on shotgun blasts occur even on a miss.
[*]The Gut Shot talent makes shotgun attacks on adjacent targets automatically hit.
[/list]
The Operative gets a sneaky tree:
[list]
[*]The Disengage ability lets the operative safely extract themselves from melee and lower their target priority
[*]The Backstab talent increases damage while the Operative is the lowest priority target
[*]The Marked Target talent leaves one exploit intact when abilities would otherwise remove them all
[*]The Vanish talent expands the Perfect Spot ability by making the operative the lowest priority target when Perfect Spot is used
[/list]
The Officer gets a heroic self-buff tree.
[list]
[*]Deeds Not Words is an ability that gives a full stat buff based on Fellowship.
[*]The Shield of Courage talent is a Deeds upgrade that adds armor to the buff
[*]The Guide My Hand talent is another Deeds buff that makes attacks automatically hit.
[*]The Audacity talent lets the officer substitute Fellowship for Agility in calculating Dodge.
[/list]
The Warrior gets a flamer tree.
[list]
[*]Fuel for the Fire is an ability that triggers instances of burning on nearby targets.
[*]Pyromaniac is a talent that refunds 1 ap the first time a flame or melta weapon is used in a turn.
[*]Conflagration is a talent that adds stracks of burning based on ballistic skill.
[*]Enveloping Flames is a talent that increases the minimum damage of flame and melta weapons based on ballistic skill.
[/list]
This is still a work in progress.Feel free to use the comments to suggest more additions to archetypes in the future.


Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","BigFlagship","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]
You will need to add the two entries for jhExpandedArchetypes following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Expanded Colony Projects
Author: jonHinkerton
About: More projects to keep your colonies busy with.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Added 10 new projects with story-based text and original item rewards.

Description:
Did you feel like you ran out of colony projects a little too soon? I did. So I made more.

Version 1.0 of Expanded Colony Projects adds 30 somewhat interdependent common new projects to all of your colonies
[list]
[*]Arbitrage projects let you trade goods around your colonies, swapping resources to keep other projects going.
[*]Development projects give you something to do with your surplus goods, by turning them into improvements to your colony stats.
[*]Faction projects let you juice your reputations a little here and there.
[/list]
There are a set of these projects available at level 2 and another at level 4. The resources traded in each colony and at each level are different so you can trade strategically.

Version 1.1 Adds 10 new projects to tier 2 and 4.
[list]
[*] The projects have story-based text and flavored rewards.
[*]Each projects trades commodities for an original item reward.
[/list]
Future development plans are up in the air. I may need to tweak the resources in/out ratios but I hope they are not disruptive as thy are.


Installation:

You will need to install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] for this mod to work.

The easiest way to install it would be to use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]﻿.

If not using ModFinder, you will need to unzip the folder into your Game's Modifications folder. The path will be similar to C:\Users\Me\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications

Once the folder is there, you may need to edit your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file. This is one level up from the mod's folder. It needs to look something like:

[code]﻿{"$id":"1","SourceDirectories":[],"EnabledModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhColonyProjects","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"ActiveModifications":["ColdTraderOccupation","jhColonyProjects","jhExpandedArchetypes"],"DisabledModifications":[]}
[/code]

You will need to add the two entries for jhColonyProjects following the format above. Once this file is edited you can start your game and you should see the mod in the in-game mod tool (not the built in Unity Mod Manager)

Name: Fix Cold Trader's Acumen
Author: Mawootad
About: Fixes Jae's Cold Trader's Acumen origin talent to give the listed bonuses to skills.
Description: Jae's Cold Trader's Acumen origin talent is supposed to give bonuses to skills based on 2x your faction rep with them, however it actually gives no bonus for Fellowship of the Void and only a 1x bonus for Kasballica and Explorators. This fixes Fellowship of the Void to give 2x faction rank to Coercion and Kasballica and Explorators to give 2x to Commerce and Tech Use respectively.

Name: Flame Weapon Expert Fix
Author: Seroster
About: A small fix for Flame Weapon Expert not affecting 3 of the unique flamers.

VersionHistory.Changelog: First Published Version

Description:
I happened to notice that, as of the current date/patch (1.2.19), 3 unique flamers have an attack that is not affected by the Flame Weapon Expert talent: Fiery Retribution (unique #3 attack), Purging Fury (#2 attack), & the Toxic Flamer (also the #2 attack.) This resulted in a situation where those attacks cost 2 AP regardless of whether you had the talent or not. I assume this is a bug (despite the latter 2 appearing to have a normal 2nd attack, in actuality all 3 affected attacks have a unique ID, which were not on the current list of attacks the talent affects), but I can't say that definitively.

Easiest way to install IMO is drag & drop the Zip into the bottom panel of the Rogue Trader version of Modfinder.

I'm hoping that Owlcat will fixt this issue themselves so none of us have to worry about this, but it is VERY unlikely I will devote any time to keeping this up to date unless I happen to be actively playing RT at that point in the future.

A rather niche fix in the grand scheme of things that I made mostly for myself, but I thought someone out there might find useful. It happens to be my first & probably? only mod I'll ever publish. Hopefully someone else will get a use out of it!

Name: Free Respec
Author: ADDB
About: Allows changing the Respec Cost Behaviour.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial Release

Description:
Allows changing the Respec Cost Behaviour.

[b]Installation[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod archive.
[*]If not done yet, launch the game at least once.
[*]Navigate to [code]%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/code]
For example, the path might look like this: [i]C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/i]

[*]Create a new folder in the UnityModManager directory and unarchive the mod archive there.
[*]Launch Rogue Trader and after reaching the Main Menu you can hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window.
[/list]

[b]Usage[/b]
To use:
[list=1]
[*]Click the button in the FreeRespec mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened by pressing CTRL + F10).

[*]Pick one of the [b]four different modes[/b]:
[list]
[*][b]Free[/b]: Respecs are always free.
[*][b]Always pay x[/b]: Respecs will cost a certain amount you can choose.
[*][b]Pay at most x[/b]: Respecs will cost the normal amount but stop getting more expensive after reaching a certain amount you can choose.
[*][b]Normal Game Behaviour[/b]: Literally normal game behaviour.
[/list]
[/list]
Since using Mods normally disables Achievements, I suggest also using the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/4]Allow Modded Achievements[/url] mod or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] to re-enable them.

Name: Heavy Bolter Patterned Variants
Author: Ezfimods
About: Adds four additional Heavy Bolters to the game. All are available to purchase from the Drusians. Safe to install into existing save files.
Description:
Adds four additional Heavy Bolters to the game. All are available to purchase from the Drusians. Safe to install into existing save files.

[b][Retobi-Pattern] Heavy Bolter
[/b][list]
[*]Slightly lower damage
[*]Higher armor penetration
[*]Available from Drusians at Reputation Level 9 for 38 Profit Factor
[/list]
[b][Mezoa-Pattern] Heavy Bolter[/b]
[list]
[*]Slightly higher damage
[*]Available from Drusians at Reputation Level 15 for 45 Profit Factor
[/list]
[b][Mars-Pattern] Heavy Bolter[/b]
[list]
[*]Higher damage
[*]Slightly higher armor penetration
[*]Higher recoil
[*]Available from Drusians at Reputation Level 22 for 65 Profit Factor
[/list]
[b][Sol-Pattern] Heavy Bolter[/b]
[list]
[*]Higher damage
[*]Higher rate of fire
[*]Larger ammo capacity
[*]Higher recoil
[*]Requires Strength 70
[*]Available from the Drusians at reputation level 30 for 100 Profit Factor
[/list]
I am not an expert on game balance (I usually play on the lower difficulties), so I am open to tweaks on the numbers and effects of these weapons. [size=5]

How To Install
[/size]This mod is available in [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/146]Modfinder[/url]. To install manually:[size=3]

[/size][list=1]
[*]Navigate to %userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\
[*]Install [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url]﻿ into the UnityModManager folder
[*]Unzip this mod into the Modifications folder
[*]Open OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json
[*]Add [code]"EzfiPatternedHeavyBolters"[/code]
to the list of EnabledModifications, between the square brackets and save the file.
[/list]If installed correctly, the mod should appear in the mods list under "DLC and Mods".

[img]https://imgur.com/9byiHvu.jpg[/img]﻿
[img]https://imgur.com/pkFzvMn.jpg[/img]

Name: Heavy Gunner AP Cost Fix
Author: Mawootad
About: Fixes Heavy Gunner and related talents increasing the cost of attacks
Description: 1.2 introduced a bug where Heavy Gunner, Flame Weapon Expert, and related talents would increase the cost of attacks from abilities such as Wildfire or Steady Superiority. This mod fixes that interaction so that free attacks are actually free.

Name: Homeworlds of the Expanse
Author: OdinThePine
About: This mod expands the selection of Homeworlds available during character creation by introducing new custom options inspired by the game's original manuals. Each world is lore-friendly and emphasizes a specific playstyle or theme.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed a bug blocking the Archetype advancement for Shrine World characters
Fixed a compatibility bug with PlayableX
Initial Release

Description:
[b]How to Install[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the file
[*]Find the Modification folder in \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications\
[*]Extract or paste the file into the Modification folder
[*]Add the folder name to the \AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\[i]OwlcatModificationManagerSettins.json[/i] file; it should look like this:[code]  "EnabledModifications": ["HomeworldsOfTheExpanse"], "ActiveModifications": ["HomeworldsOfTheExpanse"],[/code]

[*]Start a new game or create a new Companion in an existing save

[/list]You can alzo use [url=https://github.com/thehambeard/ModFinderRT]ModFinder[/url]﻿ for a easier installation.

NOTES: this is a OwlcatModManager mod and requires [url=https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/MicroPatches]MicroPatches[/url] to load properly.



With this mod I tried to expand the list of selectable Homeworlds with lore-friendly and balanced (?) options. I researched the original [i]Rogue Trader[/i] manuals, transposing, if not the Talents and stats, at least the mood and themes from the original pen-and-paper RPG.

Like the 6 vanilla options, each of the 5 new Homeworlds has an Innate Feat and a selection of 5 Talents built around the main theme, whether for gameplay or roleplay. New Homeworlds may be added in the future.

[b]Homeworlds
[/b]
[list]
[*][b]Frontier World[/b] - exotic weapons, interactions with xenos, guns
[/list][list]
[*][b]Feral World[/b] - strength, primitive weapons, berserker-like playstyle
[/list][list]
[*][b]Penal World[/b] - be mean, do crime
[/list][list]
[*][b]Shrine World[/b] - stacks of burning, grenades, extra damage against the heretics
[/list][list]
[*][b]Agri-World[/b] - toughness, incremental bonus
[/list][b]
Compatibility[/b]
Fully compatible with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/139]PlayableX[/url]﻿, except for the Navigator Origin. The quirks of OMM and UMM will create visual duplicates in the Homeworld selection.

Feel free to use the comments section to suggest additions and changes. I am not an expert in builds by any means, and your opinion could be valuable help.

[i]
[/i][i]Thanks to the community on the official Discord server for the help and guidance with this small project.[/i]

Name: MicroPatches
Author: Microsoftenator
About: Tiny patches attempting to fix minor bugs and silence annoying log messages. Experimental patches require more testing and can be toggled in the mod settings (requires restart to take effect). If you encounter any issues with an experimental patch, let me know in the issues on this repository.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
Better OwlMod Logging:
- OwlMods use their log channel (`OwlcatModification.Logger`) in place of `PFLog.Mods`
- Creates a separate log file for each mod
Additional fix for NRE in OnDeserialized
New owlmod fixes for 1.2.1.7

OwlMod fixes for 1.2

Removed LoadAssigneeAsync patch

Updated for game version 1.2.0

Removed most OwlMod patches (owlcat seem to have fixed most of them)
Fixes another owlmod patch bug
Several new fixes for OwlMod blueprint patches.

Description:
# MicroPatches (Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader)

Transmechanic Microsoftenator once again fixing bugs and cleaning logs.

Tiny patches attempting to fix minor bugs and silence annoying log messages.
Experimental patches require more testing and can be toggled in the mod settings (requires restart to take effect).
If you encounter any issues with an experimental patch, let me know in the issues on this repository.

**WARNING: ALL EXPERIMENTAL PATCHES ARE DISABLED BY DEFAULT FOR A REASON. THEY MAY BREAK YOUR GAME AND/OR SAVES. ACTIVATE AT YOUR OWN RISK.**

## Current patches as of 1.2:

### Ported from WrathPatches

- Fixed NRE in Element.AssetGuid and Element.AssetGuidShort
- SharedStringConverter.ReadJson now correctly uses ScriptableObject.CreateInstance not the class constructor. Fixes harmless but noisy template mod localization errors
- Silenced "Bind: no binding named X" messages

### Experimental

These have all recieved basic testing, but are not guaranteed to be free of issues:

- Swap calculations for CasterNamedProperty and TargetNamedProperty. Fix for: Some effects that should be using the caster's stats incorrectly use the target's stats and vice-versa.
- Ignore TurnBasedEventsTrigger on features on non-party companions. Fixes the "Infinite Seize The Initiative" bug
- Fixed EGSAchievementsManager NullReferenceExceptions
- Ignore Steam Achievements with Null ID
- Lowered the severity of missing save file warnings ("DLC has no status in the DLCCache. Defaulting to unavailable") no longer prints a stacktrace
- Silenced keybinding conflict messages
- Skip LoadAssigneeAsync - prevents internal QA error message

Name: MorePartySlotsRT
Author: ADDB
About: Increase the amount of party slots (this does not affect visual slots; it will only allow adding more members to the party).

Name: Playable X
Author: ADDB
About: Makes the Navigator, Tech-Priest and Adepta Sororitas origins pickeable for your Rogue Trader at Game Start. This might also enable you to recruit multiple Navigators mercenaries.
Description:
# Playable X  
Makes the Navigator, Tech Priest and Adepta Sororitas origins pickeable for your Rogue Trader at Game Start.
This might also enable you to recruit multiple Navigator mercenaries.

Changes compared to the previous single versions:

* After character creation finished, it should now automatically disable the option.
* Some people suggested a few things for PlayableTechPriest on Nexus (including Reject the Flesh 1 feature, TechPriestOccupation_Feature and Backpack_techpriest visual). Those should now be added by default.

## Usage  
To use:
  
1. **Before you start the character creation:** Click the button in the PlayableX mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened with **CTRL**+F10).
2. Turn the toggle for the wanted origin on on.
3. Now start creating a new character

## Additional Information  
* Because the custom origins don't have any Darkest Hours and Moments of Triumph I've unlocked all of them for the customs.
* I know that Navigator get a Custom Portrait. I've left the Portrait Choices by default since variety is way higher that way. If you want the Navigator one you can just export that one using ToyBox and import it as a Custom Portrait.

Name: Player Gender Override
Author: Microsoftenator
About: While the base game allows you to set your character's voice independently of their body type, your character's gender is determined based on your chosen body type (I = male, II = female). With this mod, you can override this behaviour.
Description:
# Player Gender Override (WH40K: Rogue Trader)

While the base game allows you to set your character's voice independently of 
their body type, your character's gender is determined based on your chosen
body type (I = male, II = female).
With this mod, you can override this behaviour.

![image](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/PlayerGenderOverride/assets/105488202/20c39903-0045-4c12-bf2a-c59ad21402ee)

When active, the game will treat your character as the chosen gender. This
affects:
- Dialogue text (titles, pronouns, etc.)
- Spoken audio (as above)
- Gender-locked quests (romance). These may break if you change gender mid-quest.

Unlike changing your character's gender with eg. Toybox, this does not affect
animations or character model, so those will not break.

In addition, when active, you may optionally override each individual term
(text only).

![image](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/PlayerGenderOverride/assets/105488202/670905c4-612b-435d-b4e9-be2b7532a916)

All settings are per-save, but this mod should not create a save dependency.

Name: Rechargeable Grenades
Author: Arkive
About: Basic grenades recharge at the end of combat.
Description:
[b][size=3]Description:[/size][/b]
Basic grenades recharge at the end of combat. Currently only affects  fire, frag, krak, and stun grenades.
Download the optional 'RechargeableConsumables' instead to have all consumables recharge at the end of combat. (thanks TKTaKo!)

[b][size=3]Installation:
[/size][/b]
1. Place the unzipped mod folder into:
[i] ﻿%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\Modifications[/i]
﻿[spoiler][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/5388/images/44/44-1702751189-444734264.jpeg[/img][/spoiler]
2. Activate the mod using either method:
﻿a. Owlcat Modfications Manager
﻿ ﻿1. Browse to your game directory 
﻿ ﻿ ﻿a. For steam: r-click the game in your library -> Manage -> Browse Local Files
﻿ ﻿ ﻿b. For GoG Galaxy: r-click the game in your library -> Manage Installation -> Show Folder
﻿ ﻿2. Open the folders: Modding\Steam Workshop tool\owlcat-modifcations-manager-win32-x64
﻿ ﻿3. Launch owlcat-modifications-manager.exe
﻿ ﻿4. In the left column titled "Installed", check the checkbox by "Rechargable Grenades (X)"
﻿b. Manually
﻿ ﻿Add the mod to:   
[i] ﻿ ﻿%LocalAppData%Low\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json
﻿ ﻿[/i]
﻿ ﻿Example OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json with this mod and toybox enabled:  [spoiler]
[code]{
"SourceDirectories": [
"UnityModManager",
"Modifications"
],
"EnabledModifications": [,
"0ToyBox0",
"RechargableGrenades"
]
}[/code][/spoiler]
3. Verify installation:
1. In the game's main menu, press[b] shift[/b]+[b]f10[/b] to open the the Owlcat Modification UI
﻿2. Rechargeable grenades should appear in the Owlcat Modification UI
﻿3. press[b] shift[/b]+[b]f10 [/b]again to close the Owlcat Modification UI
﻿[spoiler][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/5388/images/44/44-1702752661-728982874.jpeg[/img][/spoiler]

[b][size=3]Questions:[/size][/b]
[list]
[*]Can I add/remove this mod to a saved game?
[list]
[*]Short Answer: Yes
[*]Long Answer: This mod uses a blueprint patch for each consumable type changed. This means the blueprint is modified at runtime, so savefiles aren't affected.
[/list][*]Is this mod compatible with X mod?
[list]
[*]Short Answer: Most likely. I haven't found any conflicting mods yet.
[*]Long Answer: If a mod modifies the same consumable fields as this mod, load order will determine the winner.
[/list][/list]

Name: ReDress
Author: ADDB
About: Allows changing the (at character generation) chosen cosmetic options. Also allows changing origin outfit.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Changes to Includes/Excludes should now take effect without having to reload the save (Thanks to Mwitwa from a NexusMods DM for suggesting to apply a Polymorph buff to units)

- (***JonHinkerton***) Now display EE name in addition to id
- Fix caching issue for new updates

More or less experimental change to the coloring system. It is now possible to, instead of just setting a single color, create a custom sized texture with multiple colors to use.
I really don't know how useful this is. It's somewhat obvious with hair because you can create streaks and such; as for other equipment stuff I didn't really try.
Added somewhat custom color support.
Fix missing item names in Inclues Section
It should now be possible to change the color of clothes which support color change natively (which aren't a lot I think?)

Fixed Exclusion Tab not showing all EquipmentEntities for some units
Made Included Ids copyable (to share stuff and such). It is (and was) possible to search by ID and Name in the Inclusion tab.
Fixed the issue of outfits disappearing after restart if the save isn't reloaded another time.

Added Include Section. Together with Exclude this should allow creating arbitrary Outfits using the game's Equipment Entities
Fixed some stuff not working out
Fixed some issues that would occur when loading different Saves

Now properly allows changing clothes for you and your companions (the process is a little more involved for companions; though it should still work). It was necessary to somewhat adjust the process for that. Read the ingame guide for more information.

Description:
[b]Installation[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Download the mod archive.
[*]If not done yet, launch the game at least once.
[*]Navigate to [code]%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/code]
For example, the path might look like this: [i]C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\[/i]

[*]Create a new folder in the UnityModManager directory and unarchive the mod archive there.
[*]Launch Rogue Trader and after reaching the Main Menu you can hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window.
[/list]

[b]Usage[/b]
To change the appeareance you will have to go through character creation. In there, [b]everything other than visual options are ignored[/b].
To use:
[list=1]
[*]Click the button in Redress mod section of the UnityModManager GUI (opened by pressing CTRL + F10)
[*][b]There should be a small toggle at the top of the section. Activating that brings up a small explantion on how to use the mod.[/b]
[/list]
Since using Mods normally disables Achievements, I suggest also using the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/4]Allow Modded Achievements[/url] mod or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kroguetrader/mods/1]Toy Box[/url] to re-enable them.

Name: Skill Check Assistant
Author: AlterAsc
About: Allows taking (rolling preset value) when doing skill checks. Available options are: roll normally, take 50, take 33, take 25, take 10, take 1. Settings are per individual skill.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
- Additional option to roll check normally if chosen "Take X" is not enough to succeed
- Fix for checks sometimes not being displayed in the log.
Updated for game full release
Support for characteristics checks
Initial release

Description:
# Skill Check Assistant mod for Warhammer 40K: Rogue Trader

Allows taking (rolling preset value) when doing skill checks.
Available options are: roll normally, take 50, take 33, take 25, take 10, take 1.
Settings are per individual skill.

By default everything is rolled normally.

### Added in 1.3.0

Option `If chosen "Take X" value is not low enough to succeed, try rolling check normally.`
Default: off   
This is for when you want to take X when X is enough, and try to roll if it's not. For playstyle where you don't want to reload for easy checks, but want to make harder ones a gamble and make use of things that allow rerolling (like Advanced Skill).


## Installation
1. Unpack archive directly into `%userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\` WITHOUT creating additional archive named folder.
2. After running the game, navigate to UMM mod settings (press Ctrl-F10) and set settings as you need.

Resulting structure of already existing UnityModManager folder should be as follows
- `SkillCheckAssistant` (folder)
	- `SkillCheckAssistant.dll`
	- `Info.info`

## How to build (for developers only)
1. Set up RoguePath environment variable to point to game folder
2. Restore nuget packages
3. Clean Solution.
4. Build (note that on build output is automatically copied to installation path).

Name: ToyBox (a bag of tricks)
Author: Narria
About: Toy Box is a cute and playful mod with 400+ cheats, tweaks and quality of life improvements. It was created in the spirit of Bag of Tricks & Cheat Menu but with a little different focus.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
* (***ADDB***) Add LoadPreset BP Action for BlueprintAreaPresets.
* (***ADDB***) Patch Tool:
  * Creating a new Element or Component now automatically assigns the Owner Blueprint.
  * Fix null strings crashing UI.
  * Fix UI Clipboard Label inverted Logic.
* (***ADDB***) Prevent certain exceptions in Search 'n Pick with modded BPs

* (***ADDB***) Various Patch Tool UI fixes (Thanks to I *ifarmpandas* for testing)

***1.7.0***

* (***ADDB***) Implemented new ***Blueprint Patch Tool***
* (***ADDB***) Reimplemented Allow Equipment Change During Combat. That one was more complicated to fix than I expected...
* (***ADDB***) Hide Loot Coloring Options, since we don't actually have a heuristic to determine how valuable an object is.

***1.6.12***

* (***ADDB***) Rewrite the Psychic Phenomena customizer since it seems like it might've caused crashes for some people.

***1.6.11***

* (***ADDB***) Reinstall on checksum failure now reinstalls current version.
* (***ADDB***) Fix very rare issue with Browser.

### Patch Tool
- A very ~~un~~necessary feature that allows Real-Time editing of Blueprints: 
  - Modify damage values of weapons, ability costs, and other numerical fields directly within the game
  - This allows changing most fields in Blueprints, including
    - Primitives (int, string, float, ...)
    - (Flag-)Enums
    - Ability References
    - Collections (with special support for Component Arrays)
    - General Reference Types
- Changes to a Blueprint are saved as so-called Patch Files.

- While the feature is powerful, there are some intentional restrictions. Most of those restrictions are because this is meant to be a tool for small Tweaks. If you feel limited by this, feel free to try out Owlcat's official Modding Template, since that works with a similar idea.
  - A Blueprint can only have one single patch applied (but one patch can do different things)
  - You can't create new Blueprints
  - The Patch Format is not the same as Owlcat's native jbp_patch format; it uses its own patching backend
  - Fields containing Unity Objects can't be modified

* (***ADDB***) Implemented new ***Blueprint Patch Tool***
* (***ADDB***) Reimplemented Allow Equipment Change During Combat. That one was more complicated to fix than I expected...
* (***ADDB***) Hide Loot Coloring Options, since we don't actually have a heuristic to determine how valuable an object is.

***1.6.12***

* (***ADDB***) Rewrite the Psychic Phenomena customizer since it seems like it might've caused crashes for some people.

***1.6.11***

* (***ADDB***) Reinstall on checksum failure now reinstalls current version.
* (***ADDB***) Fix very rare issue with Browser.

### Patch Tool
- A very ~~un~~necessary feature that allows Real-Time editing of Blueprints: 
  - Modify damage values of weapons, ability costs, and other numerical fields directly within the game
  - This allows changing most fields in Blueprints, including
    - Primitives (int, string, float, ...)
    - (Flag-)Enums
    - Ability References
    - Collections (with special support for Component Arrays)
    - General Reference Types
- Changes to a Blueprint are saved as so-called Patch Files.

- While the feature is powerful, there are some intentional restrictions. Most of those restrictions are because this is meant to be a tool for small Tweaks. If you feel limited by this, feel free to try out Owlcat's official Modding Template, since that works with a similar idea.
  - A Blueprint can only have one single patch applied (but one patch can do different things)
  - You can't create new Blueprints
  - The Patch Format is not the same as Owlcat's native jbp_patch format; it uses its own patching backend
  - Fields containing Unity Objects can't be modified

Description:
# ToyBox

### Install & Setup (Rogue)

1. Download the ToyBox mod file and unzip
1. If the folder is not already named 0ToyBox0 please rename it to that
1. Launch the game at least once.
1. **Please note that the game comes with its own built in Unity Mod Manager so you do not need to install another one**
1. Navigate to %userprofile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
1. An example path is C:\Users\PC\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Warhammer 40000 Rogue Trader\UnityModManager\
1. Copy 0ToyBox0 into the UnityModManagerFolder
1. Launch Rogue Trader and you may need to hit ctrl+F10 to see the mod manager window
1. Load a save or start a new game to get the most out of of the mod

* Warning: ToyBox for Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader is a complex mod. Save early and often.
* Note: If you find non-functioning features, please report them.

### Usage
Here is a summarized list of features. This list only includes a part of the features contained in the mod.

-  **Bag of Tricks**: 
    * Allow both male and female RTs to romance Heinrix and Cassia
    * Allow Remote Companions to join into dialog
    * Modify Faction Reputation, Navigator's Insight, Scrap and more
    * Experience Multiplier
    * Dice Roll Cheats/Options
    * Enable Achievements with Mods installed
- **Level Up**: Make Respec start from Level 0 for you and Companions
- **Party Editor**: Modify your own conviction and/or stats or features or portraits or voices of party members or Respec Characters for free
- **Colonies**: Modify different Colony Resources
- **Search 'n Pick**: this lets you search through various available things (items, feats, abilities, unity and locations) and spawn/give/summon them
  and manipulate your game state in an almost limitless set of ways. You can add/remove items, feats, abilities,
  etc. You can spawn any unit. You can start/unstart/complete etudes, quests, etc. You can teleport to any area in the
  game. It is almost unimaginable how much you can do in here so keep digging!
- **Etudes**: this is a new and exciting feature that allows you to see for the first time the structure and some basic
  relationships of Etudes and other Elements that control the progression of your game story. Etudes are hierarchical in
  structure and additionally contain a set of Elements that can both conditions to check and actions to execute when the
  etude is started. As you browe you will notice there is a disclosure triangle next to the name which will show the
  children of the Etude. Etudes that have Elements will offer a second disclosure triangle next to the status that will
  show them to you.
  WARNING: this tool can both miraculously fix your broken progression or it can break it even further. Save and back up
  your save before using. Remember that "with great power comes great responsibility"
- **Quest Resolution**: this allows you to view your active quests and advance them as needed to work around bugs or
  skip quests you don't want to do. Be warned this may break your game progression if used carelessly.

# How to contribute
- Make sure you have Visual Studio 22 (or current) installed and other tools you might want.  See [WotR Modding Beginners Guide](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/OwlcatModdingWiki/wiki/Beginner-Guide) for more info
- on the [main repository page](https://github.com/cabarius/ToyBox) click on "fork" in the upper-right corner
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-fork.jpg "github fork button position")
- on your personal fork of the repository clone to your computer ([multiple method avaiable, chose the one you prefeer](https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/creating-and-managing-repositories/cloning-a-repository))
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-clone-1.jpg "github code button position")
![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-clone-2.jpg "github code button preview")
- create a branch in your fork with a short description of your contribution (e.g. `git checkout -b my-contribution-descriptor`)

![alt text](./documentation-assets/github-new-branch.jpg "git checkout -b example")
- do your magic with the code
- push to your fork
- open a pull-request from your fork to the main repository

# Development Setup
1. Install ToyBox mod into your game via Unity Mod Manager
1. Clone the git repo
1. Build the solution twice and restart Visual Studio
1. Now you can just change things and build the solution and it will automatically build and install into the mod folder in the game
1. **Important** If you are adding a feature or fixing a bug please add a release note entry to the *ReadMe.md*.  This is how we tell our the world about your great work^_^
    1. Find the highest release name near the top. It will look something like `### Ver 1.3.7 (Coming Soon)`. 
    1. Usually it is 0.0.1 higher than the current release but please check on Nexus.  If not please add a new Version entry at the top for the next release using proper markdown. 
    1. Don't worry too much about getting this right as Narria Cabarius will clean this up on merge so when in doubt add a new version.
    1. format your release note like like this:
    >```* (Jane/JoeCoolCollaborator) added a Coolness Multiplier in Bag of Tricks that makes your main character that much more awesome!```

**PS**: 

Learn to mod Owlcat Games (Kingmaker and Wrath of the Righteous) [here](https://github.com/spacehamster/OwlcatModdingWiki/wiki/Beginner-Guide)
        
[Join our discord](https://discord.gg/owlcat) and go to #mod-dev-technical and #mod-user-general meet the mod authors: **Narria** and her kind collaborators **ArcaneTrixter**, **Aphelion (SonicZentropy)**, **Delth** and others.  We love to chat about modding and teaching others to mod.
